column4: and still be myself.

column1: 79$Bipolar Depression$3/13/2014 5:27:45 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$4$5$"I have been taking Sertraline for 5 months now and I love it!  During the first 2-4 weeks I did experience some dizziness
column2: light-headedness
column3: nauceousness
column4: etc...but that only lasted that short period of time while my body became used to it.  Now
column5: it makes me less irritable and I just seem to have a more positive mood
column6: more often.  No drug is 100% effective
column7: but this one is pretty close!  I went off of it for about a month around Christmas time because I became very busy and kept putting off getting my refill
column8: and boy could I tell a HUGE difference!  My anxiety came back full force
column10: and my mood swings were quite often.  Once I got my refill and started back up
column11: it was good again!  I hate that I feel like I'll never be able to be without medication to be ""normal""
column12: but I am very thankful that I found something that works so well for me! "

408$Bipolar Depression$12/28/2008 10:44:48 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$I have been on prozac, lexapro, wellbutrin, and effexor.  Finally my doctor switched me to sertraline 50mg about four months ago and I feel amazing.  This rx has been a lifesaver for me!  I have gained a few pounds, but don't believe it's from the medication.  I really believe that I am much more happier and relaxed and have been more social, going out and what not.  I believe that's where the weight came from.  The only thing is that if I miss a dose, I can immediately tell within 12-24 hours, and my anxiety begins coming back.  I highly highly recommend this medication for someone with depression/manic phases/anxiety.  Excellent med.

This medications seems to be helping coupled with another.  The side effects that I have are insomnia, VERY crazy dreams, VERY vivid dreams, sex drive is nonexistant and coming to an orgasm is tricky.  For the insomnia I purchased melatonin and I take it when I NEED sleep because I can't function.  Usually one a week.  The dreams can be good or bad but the fact that I can remember them can be horrible when they're bad dreams because it feels like I'm awake.  My sex drive tanked but I have a great significant other and he makes sure that the mood is set and when I have trouble having an orgasm we just take our time, go slow and talk to each other.  Since I've been taking the medication I've only had an issue with an orgasm 3 or 4 times.

1154$Bipolar Depression$9/19/2011 5:55:23 PM$Reviewer: kayosphere, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$In 2008
column2: I was put through the ringer on multiple medications as my doctor and I searched and searched for appropriate treatments for my mood disorder. While my other medications quarantined the majority of my symptoms
column3: including the most severe spikes in my moods and the worst outbursts of my impulsiveness
column4: I was lingering in a generally unhappy and psychologically unstable depressive zone
column5: and I was completely miserable. Five months ago
column6: Zoloft was added to control the last bits of anxiety I was having at work. It completely removed paranoia
column10: and everything that comes along with those symptoms
column11: and it made me feel more ""normal"" and confident than I have ever felt since I can remember in my 28 years. Within the last six months
column12: I have been through a divorce
column14: and I have lost my father to alcoholic liver disease. It was just two months after my divorce when my psychiatrist added Zoloft to my other medications. I have not taken an anti-anxiety pill since I've been on Zoloft
column15: and I have never felt better. The mood swings I experienced after taking any sort of anti-anxiety drugs were far too severe
column16: so it was simply better for me to avoid them and deal with the stability of the anxiety rather than the anxiety and the anger that accompanied it when I was ""coming down"" off of the drug. With the help of Zoloft
column17: I have improved myself three-fold; I'm making leaps and bounds socially
column21: and it is completely amazing what a difference I see in myself because I have been able to accept the help others have offered me. I see the strength within myself to keep on going rather than curl into a ball and lock myself away into a deep dark hole. Everything is tolerable; life is much brighter. There are still sucky days
column22: but I never have trouble being optimistic. I've seen hell
column23: and I know I can conquer it."

1272$Bipolar Depression$4/6/2011 8:03:54 PM$Reviewer: SC_84, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$4$5$I've been on Zoloft on and off for 5+ years, starting it again when I was in the first trimester of pregnancy d/t major depression and paralyzing anxiety. No birth defects in my daughter! She is almost 2yrs old now and very happy nad healthy! I am as well! Taking this medication in conjuction with Lamictal has helped immensely to curb my drastic changes in mood.  I can effectively communicate my feelings and do so without becoming overwhelmed or hostile. I have noticed that taking a dosage as high as I do has serious side effects when combined with copius amounts of alcohol! It recently caused me to have a psychotic episode, landing me in a psychiatric hospital after a suicide attempt.  I have since been sober and am letting the medication work to it's full potential. I was also diagnosed with ADHD and severe anxiety disorder which is managed with adderal and alprazolam. This mixture of medication is ideal for my conditions, only thing I've noticed is the decrease in sex drive, which I don't consider a bad thing, as I believe it was one of my addictions in the past. I'd much rather be healthy and happy than fall back into my old self-destructive ways! I do contribute my wellness to the medication and supportive people in my life. I have a reason to be here and I can clearly see that now! ;-)

25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $3$2$5$I'm going to be brutally honest. At first

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$4$3$"Having dealt with Anxiety
column3: Depression
column4: PTSD
column5: and OCD for the last 10 years -- Zoloft has helped me immensely.  In my experience it starts to alleviate symptoms w/in 1-2 weeks
column6: but finding the correct dosage is critical; too high of a dose tended to promote mania for me.

column2: I tried Paxil for 1 1/2 years but my experience with it at 10-40mg was that Paxil
column3: although effective
column4: made me feel “mentally numb.""

column1: A switch to Zoloft proved to better treat my symptoms without the “numbness.” But I was still symptomatic for 2 years while taking only 100mg.  After an increase to 150mg I felt much better
column2: but had to watch out for manic episodes.

column1: Side effects: these are well documented.  Starting
column2: stopping
column3: increasing/decreasing brings on: ""electric shock"" sensations in arms and legs
column4: waking up frequently at night
column5: clenching one's jaw while sleeping
column6: and disturbing lucid dreams.  At times I felt I was losing my mind
column7: especially when I abruptly stopped taking the medication.  It has been my experience that these side effects abate w/in 2 weeks.

column1: Also to note: for anxiety and mania
column2: caffeine is the devil!!  Switching to decaf was essential to my progress.  Even just one cup o' joe would launch me into major anxiety and/or mania for days.  I can't stress enough how critical this was for me.
they’re a problem.  My gf told me I “needed to have a long talk with Mr. Wiener.”  We broke up.  It helps to have a girlfriend who is supportive
column3: not selfish
column4: about your progress.

column2: including Zoloft as a part of my therapy has opened doors for me that have been shut for years.  After a stressful six-year military career
column3: and having up and quit seven jobs since
column4: failing in semester after semester of college
column5: surviving a school shooting
column6: and a tragic end to a 2-year relationship
column7: I was suicidal every day.  Taking Zoloft helped me overcome my symptoms for Anxiety
column11: and helped me get back living again.

35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$3$4$"I find this medication is VERY effective in the treatment of my depression.  I hate the side effects
column3: though.  For me
column4: I often have no appetite
column5: I have a very decreased sexual desire
column6: and sometimes I feel very NEUTRAL about things.  (I know that the medication is meant to level my moods
column7: but it often makes me feel ""stuck"" in the middle
column8: and I find it difficult to motivate myself to do things.  I recognize that is a side effect for me
column9: so I have to make an effort to ""jump start"" myself out of the ""funk"" that I feel.

column2: but NOT taking my medication is WORSE.  If I don't take my Zoloft as prescribed
column3: after about 2 days
column4: I really start to feel funny.  (I get what I call the ""blinkies""
column5: I hear swishing when I blink or turn my head quickly.  It is kind of like the sound you hear when you have water in your ears.  It is bothersome.  After a few more days
column6: I begin to notice a severe change in my mood.  I fly off the handle or cry or get emotional over the most minor things.  I have tried just about every antidepressant there is
column7: and even with the side effects
column8: I have the best results with Zoloft."

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver) $4$3$5$After being off all meds for several yrs my husbands bipolar disorder almost took our marriage. Now on zoloft for only a short time we are pleased with his results thus far although the initial adjustment period was awful.With the help of the docs and pharmacists we were reassured that the side effects (new onset panic attacks
column3: insomnia
column4: jitters) would subside and they did in about a week for him.I would strongly recommend a support system be in place in the event of the side effects he initially experienced.His fear of sexual side effects has turned out opposite for him.We have  learned that zoloft is used to treat some sexual problems which explains why my our satisfying sex life has gone back to the frequency and duration of our dating days.
